node.title: State of emergency declared in Buller after heavy rain
node.description: Westport has been cut off by road after more than 160mm of rain fell in less than 24 hours, and people in flood-prone parts of the town were warned they may need to evacuate.
node.content:
["A state of emergency has been declared again in Buller as heavy rain cuts off road access to Westport.", "", "
(file photo) Photo: RNZ / Samantha Gee
", "It comes five days after the last state of emergency was lifted, following torrential rain and flooding which prompted the evacuation of hundreds of homes.", "The Buller River is running at 11 metres and rising after a night of record-breaking rainfall.", "Buller Emergency Management officials said the rainfall was a lot more than expected and the Inangahua and Buller Rivers were being closely monitored.", "There may be small-scale evacuations of low-lying areas today, and anyone whose property was flooded in the heavy rain last July was encouraged to evacuate as a precaution, they said.", "Evacuation centres have been arranged again for residents at Sergeants Hill Hall and South School Hall.", "In Westport, firefighters received eight calls from people whose homes had either flooded or were at risk of flooding.", "People from Seddonville and Mokihinui north of the town have been evacuated, while around two households had to leave their homes at Waimangaroa because a slip was threatening their properties.", "A number of roads in the Buller district are closed because of flooding and slips, including State Highway 6 - which is closed along the coast from Punakaiki to Westport, and inland to Inangahua.", "SH69 is closed between Inangahua and Reefton, and State Highway 7 between Springs Junction and Reefton, while SH6 and SH65 are closed from Murchison to Springs Junction.", "MetService meteorologist Lewis Ferris said a more than 160mm of rain was recorded at Westport airport in less than 24 hours.", "That "smashed" the record for a 24-hour period set just last week.", "February was also likely to be the wettest month on record, Ferris told Morning Report.", ""This has been two very large rainfall events very close together which is very bad news for local residents.""]
